main.name: sound
main.description: The `sound` objects holds all the audio related things. Sounds will automatically be added when you load an audio file with `Game.loader`.

children.name: Player
children.description: The Player object is returned by `Game.sound.play()` and allows for several sound-related controls, (like pause, stop, volume etc.) as defined by the audio API.

arguments.name: sound
arguments.description: The sound to control from this Player.

children.name: stop
children.description: Stop/pause the sound. A soudn can always be resumed with `Player.play()`.

children.name: add
children.description: Add a sound (`<audio>` element) to the Game.

arguments.name: sound/URL
arguments.description: The audio element that holds the sound, or the URL where the audio file is located. Alias of `Game.loader.load()`.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: The optional, unique name of this sound, so you can easily play it later on. When passing in a DOM element, the name is required.

children.name: get
children.description: Get the sound with the given name or URL.

arguments.name: URL/name
arguments.description: The name or URL of the sound to get.

children.name: play
children.description: Play the sound with given name.

arguments.name: name/URL
arguments.description: The name or URL of the sound (This won't download the file. The URL is only for identifying purposes).
